description:
Why work for us?

  • We have a genuine commitment to gender equity 
  • Up to 38% of our new recruits are female 
  • We’ve won numerous awards including the Victorian Employer Award for Apprentice Development, Victorian Large Employer of the Year and Australian Large Employer of the Year in 2016
  • We offer competitive salaries and benefits, three months' paid maternity leave, on-going training and development. 


Our stats

  • In November 2010 13.9% of our workforce was female and in February 2017 this has increased to 21.7% … and we continue to focus on this space.
  • We are proud to say that Metro Trains Melbourne won the Australasian Railway Association’s Diversity Award in 2015, which recognised the work that was undertaken in our trainee driver ranks where female participation climbed from 2.7% to peak at 50.6%.

Who are we?

Metro is one of the largest employers in Melbourne and we offer a broad range of career experiences and promote our people having a good work/life balance. We not only operate Melbourne’s metropolitan rail service, we are working closely with the Victorian government to help build and shape our city by working on important infrastructure projects including the new Melbourne Tunnel, Level Crossing removals amongst other key initiatives. We aim to encourage the Melbourne communities’ vibrant and ever evolving lifestyles, by providing a seamless transport solution to keep individuals connected.


Our shareholders:

Metro Trains Melbourne is a consortium of rail and construction businesses, all of which have unrivalled credentials. The Metro team draws on the strengths and experience of three leading rail industry organisations: Hong Kong’s MTR Corporation, Australia’s John Holland Group and UGL Rail, a division of United Group Limited.

Our Diversity and Inclusion approach:

Diversity and Inclusion, and more specifically gender equity, have been a focus for Metro over the last few years. We have a clear strategy and a passionate focus on this important work. It’s all about building our culture and paving the way for an even more diverse and inclusive workplace experience. To us, diversity is about promoting diversity of thought and encouraging a workplace culture that fosters different thinking and innovation of ideas to drive change. We’re committed to taking real action to increase our attention on three focus areas - gender equity, cultural and age diversity – all which will help us evolve as an organisation.


Supported by our Executive Team, the Diversity and Inclusion Council was established in early 2017 to roll out new initiatives within each Division. The focus is development and implementation of tangible initiatives that penetrate to the heart of our business and champion cultural change, which is led and driven by senior leaders across the business. Other initiatives that form part of our Diversity and Inclusion strategy include all of our senior leaders attending Inclusive Leadership workshops, a Women in Leadership Mentoring and Development programme and Divisional Action Planning to support each part of the business to implement bespoke initiatives to increase female representation as well as broaden our age and cultural profile.

We hope you will consider Metro as an employer and take a look the range of roles we are advertising around Engineering, Project Management, Customer Experience, Finance, Safety, Train operations and other Corporate areas.
